channel.title: No-IP question
channel.description:
Hello, im having a tiny bit of trouble with No-IP. Ok, well i have everything done, i have my no ip adress and everything, but i have heard alot about it and heard that i had to do something with my router, now thats my problem. I dont know what i have to do with my router, and how to do it. [glow=green,2,300]I would really appriciate it if you could please post it below.[/glow]
[glow=red,2,300]Thanks[/glow] ;D
[glow=red,2,300]HAPPY 2007!!![/glow] :D[br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2007, 08:16:30 PM[/size][hr]Id rep if i could :D[br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2007, 08:17:18 PM[/size][hr]Can anyone help?[br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2007, 09:15:22 PM[/size][hr]Pretty Please? with sugar on top? a cherry? :D

item.title: No-IP question
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

do you know your staticip and everything to find this stuff goto run in the windows menu
and put in ipconfig and it should hook you uo with some things then goto settings internet connections and click options then switch to the ipconfig you look up and put the stuff from i config to then to fins the internet thingy find at the top in the box protocol tc/ip
and go to properties and use the following whatever and fill it in with the things you look up

example

IP address: . . .
submask: . . .
deafult gateway: . . .
fill those in and then go to your routers ip(which mines 192.168.1.1
and usally the pass is admin just ignore the username if it doesnt work
then go to games appication and fill it in with
name of app portstart portend and click the enable botton
and if my way doesnt work(it usally doesnt)
then look here

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic
